author: Chris Davie
title: Djibril Sidibe wants regular football guarantee before leaving Monaco
text:
Djibril Sidibe has been linked with Chelsea and Manchester United. (Getty Images) Monaco right-back Djibril Sidibe has revealed he wants a guarantee of regular playing time if he is to join the Premier League this summer.
Arsenal failed with an attempt to sign 24-year-old last year, while Chelsea and Manchester United have been linked with a move at the end of the season.
‘Every player wants to play against the best in the best leagues,’ Sidibe told RMC.
‘Today, I’m lucky to play with Monaco in a good team. We’re in the Champions League, we’re scoring lots of goals and we’re still capable of winning every competition.
Arsenal failed in their attempt to sign Sidibe last summer. (AFP/Getty Images) More: Football Antonio Conte report card: Near-perfect start with Chelsea on course for the double

‘The risk is to go to a big club is be a substitute, to go backwards, to be loaned out, it’s always complicated. My criteria is playing time.
‘Having said that, if a club that I can’t turn down wants me and can guarantee me playing time I would have to think about it.
‘But for now, I am very happy at Monaco. I would like to settle into my position and become one of the best in the world.’
